inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient reports that he has been on insulin since the time of his diagnosis, and he has never been prescribed oral agents for diabetes management.

inclusion.criterion: Using daily insulin therapy for at least one year
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient reports that he has been on insulin since the time of his diagnosis, and he has never been prescribed oral agents for diabetes management.

inclusion.criterion: Uninterrupted internet access while study system is being used overnight and for upload of study data in the morning
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Living with a significant other or family member ("companion") committed to participating in all study activities, and being present and available to provide assistance when the system is being used at night
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Diabetic ketoacidosis in the past 3 months
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: The patient reports that he has had previous episodes of diabetic ketoacidosis, for which he was hospitalized.

exclusion.criterion: Hypoglycemic seizure or loss of consciousness in the past 6 months
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of seizure disorder (except for hypoglycemic seizure)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of any heart disease including coronary artery disease, heart failure, or arrhythmias
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Current use of oral/inhaled glucocorticoids, beta-blockers or other medications, which in the judgment of the investigator would be a contraindication to participation in the study.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of ongoing renal disease (other than microalbuminuria). Creatinine level must have been obtained within the last year if subject has diabetes of >10 years duration.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: If creatinine is >1.5 mg/dL (132 µmol/L), the subject is excluded.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient has had previous episodes of diabetic ketoacidosis, but his current episode appears to be well-managed.
